intro: Coccoloba gigantifolia, commonly known as the giant lacquered leaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, palmate leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in diameter. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in clusters, and it produces edible berries that are dark red when mature. Coccoloba gigantifolia is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its striking foliage.
